snippet: Gov. Pete Wilson signed into law late Friday a bill that for the first time will allow death-row prisoners in California to choose execution by lethal injection as an alternative to the state's gas chamber.   The Governor said he hoped the new law...
lead_paragraph: Gov. Pete Wilson signed into law late Friday a bill that for the first time will allow death-row prisoners in California to choose execution by lethal injection as an alternative to the state's gas chamber. The Governor said he hoped the new law would stop last-minute appeals like those filed by convicted murderer Robert Alton Harris, the first person to die in the California gas chamber in 25 years.

headline.main: California Inmates Get Choice in Executions
